sentence: In a letter sent Thursday, Rep. Jim Jordan of Ohio and Rep. Mike Johnson of Louisiana asked Mr. Wray if the FBI has located a cache of missing files from applications submitted to the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court.
author: Emily Zantow
title: GOP lawmakers demand FBI detail efforts to rein in secret surveillance warrants

sentence: Ohio Rep. Jim Jordan, the top Republican on the House Judiciary Committee, is requesting the Justice Department provide information about its new domestic terrorism office, considering the agency’s plans last year regarding parents at school board meetings.
author: Fix This Nation Staff
title: Are School Parents A Target With DOJ’s New Domestic Terror Office?

sentence: “The Judiciary Committee will have oversight in the next session of Congress.” Biggs and fellow Republican Reps. Jim Jordan of Ohio and Mike Johnson of Louisiana have written a letter to FBI Director Christopher Wray for an unredacted copy of the audit.
author: STATION GOSSIP
title: FBI Made Mistakes Across Hundreds of Cases, But Here's What's Happening Now That Republicans Have Found Out

sentence: “The Judiciary Committee will have oversight in the next session of Congress.” Biggs and fellow Republican Reps. Jim Jordan of Ohio and Mike Johnson of Louisiana have written a letter to FBI Director Christopher Wray for an unredacted copy of the audit.
title: FBI Made Mistakes Across Hundreds Of Cases, But Here’s What Republicans Have Found Out…

sentence: “The White House has denied that Wolosky was involved in the Afghanistan Central Bank assets deliberations,” acknowledged Reps. Jim Jordan, R-Ohio, Mike Johnson, R-La., and Nicole Malliotakis, R-N.Y., in their joint letter sent Tuesday.
author: Tristan Justice
title: Did Biden Funnel $3.5 Billion Payout Away From Terror Victims And Toward Ex-Staff? Republicans Demand Answer
